1.description: The legendary witcher continues his journey, seeking contracts and dealing with the complexities of a world where humans and non-humans clash.

3.description: Reveals more of his emotional depth and capacity for love, particularly regarding children and his desire for normalcy he can never have.
The young princess of Cintra, Geralt's Child Surprise. A spirited girl with ashen hair and green eyes, showing early signs of great power.

6.description: After the fall of Cintra, she's a refugee seeking Geralt. Shows remarkable resilience and the beginning of her extraordinary abilities.

1.description: The powerful sorceress continues her tumultuous relationship with Geralt. Their bond, created by the djinn's wish, remains strong but complicated.

4.description: Shows vulnerability about her inability to have children and her complex feelings about family and belonging.

2.description: The famous bard continues to accompany Geralt, getting into romantic troubles and providing both comic relief and surprising wisdom.
A young poetess with blue eyes and a beautiful voice. Falls in love with Geralt but understands his heart belongs to Yennefer.

1.description: A mysterious knight who hires Geralt for a dragon hunt. Later revealed to be the golden dragon Villentretenmerth in human form.
Two fierce warrior women from Zerrikania who serve as bodyguards to Borch Three Jackdaws. Skilled fighters who can match any man.
A dwarven warrior and leader of a band of dwarven fighters. Practical, brave, and harbors the typical dwarven dislike of elves.
A wizard who joins the dragon hunt. Opposed to killing dragons and secretly plans to save the creature.
A pious knight errant who refuses to fight for money. Brave but rigid in his beliefs, seeing the world in black and white.

3.description: A young dryad in Brokilon Forest who helps care for Ciri. Shows the fierce protectiveness dryads have for their forest.
The silver-eyed leader of the dryads in Brokilon Forest. Ancient and wise, she protects the forest from human encroachment.
A young man transformed into a tree in Brokilon Forest as punishment for entering the dryad domain. Serves as a warning to others.

5.description: A bruxa (vampire) who preys on merchants near Oxenfurt. Beautiful and deadly, she uses her charms to lure victims.
The head of the Temple Guard in Oxenfurt and leader of the Church of the Eternal Fire. Known for his persecution of non-humans and mages.

4.description: A powerful sorceress and advisor to King Vizimir of Redania. Cunning and politically astute, she's one of the most influential mages.
A young but incredibly powerful sorcerer. Handsome and charismatic, he's rising quickly in the Brotherhood of Sorcerers.
The rectoress of Aretuza, the magical academy for young sorceresses. Stern but fair, she trained many of the current generation of sorceresses.
An elven sorceress of incredible beauty and power. One of the few elves in the Brotherhood of Sorcerers.

1.description: The young King of Caingorn who hires dragon hunters to kill the dragon terrorizing his lands. Ambitious and somewhat naive.
A crude dragon hunter who joins the expedition. Known for his vulgarity and greed rather than skill.
An experienced and brutal dragon hunter who leads one of the hunting parties. Values dragon parts over dragon lives.
A member of Boholt's dragon hunting party. Less experienced than his leader but equally mercenary.
A dwarf warrior in Yarpen Zigrin's company. Skilled with ax and crossbow.
Another dwarf in Yarpen's company, known for his loyalty and combat skills.
A dwarf in Yarpen Zigrin's company during the dragon hunt. Experienced fighter and loyal companion.

2.description: A sea captain in Bremervoord who knows about the mysterious sea creature terrorizing the coast.
A young fisherman in Bremervoord whose boat was attacked by the sea creature. Provides firsthand testimony.
A local woman in Bremervoord who runs a tavern where bards and travelers gather. Knows local legends.
The local leader of Bremervoord who hires Geralt to deal with the sea monster threatening their fishing industry.

3.description: A young dryad archer in Brokilon Forest. Skilled with a bow and fiercely protective of the forest.
Another dryad in Brokilon, older and more experienced than Braenn. Serves as a guide and guardian.
A dryad healer in Brokilon who tends to wounded creatures and lost travelers who are deemed worthy.
A merchant whose caravan was attacked near Brokilon Forest. One of the few survivors to tell the tale.
A noble who has territorial disputes near Brokilon Forest. His men sometimes clash with the dryads.

4.description: A sorceress who participates in the magical gatherings. Known for her volatile temper and powerful magic.
A sorcerer who attends the magical council meetings. More conservative in his approach to magic and politics.
A sorcerer involved in the Brotherhood's political discussions. Represents interests from the northern kingdoms.
A wizard who participates in the magical community's political debates. Known for his scholarly approach.

1.description: A sorcerer and archaeologist who was Yennefer's former lover. Still harbors feelings for her despite her relationship with Geralt.

2.description: A ship captain in Bremervoord who has experience with sea monsters and provides maritime expertise.
A halfling musician who performs at the taverns in Bremervoord. Friend to traveling bards.
A successful halfling merchant who trades throughout the northern kingdoms. Known for his business acumen.
A halfling woman in Bremervoord who runs a boarding house for travelers and merchants.

5.description: A priest of Melitele in Oxenfurt who provides spiritual guidance and healing to those in need.
A knight of the Order of the Flaming Rose who represents the militant branch of the Eternal Fire religion.
The captain of the Oxenfurt city guard who maintains order and deals with the various factions in the city.

4.description: The King of Redania who employs sorceresses as advisors and is involved in the political machinations of the northern kingdoms.

6.description: A witcher from the School of the Cat encountered during Geralt's search for Ciri. More aggressive than Wolf School witchers.
A merchant from the south who brings news of Nilfgaard's military movements and Cintra's situation.
A survivor of Cintra's fall who recognizes Ciri and helps Geralt understand what happened to the kingdom.
The merchant who has been caring for Ciri during her flight from Cintra. Shows kindness to the orphaned princess.

1.description: A guard captain who leads King Niedamir's escort on the dragon hunt expedition.
A veteran sergeant who has experience with monster hunts and serves under Captain Dahl.
A dwarven warrior who accompanies Yarpen Zigrin on the dragon hunt.
Another member of Yarpen's dwarven company, skilled with axes and crossbows.
The youngest member of Yarpen's company, eager to prove himself in battle.
The expedition's cook who prepares meals for the dragon hunting party.
An experienced tracker who follows the dragon's trail through the mountains.
A young page who serves King Niedamir during the dragon hunt expedition.

2.description: A local fisherman in Bremervoord who has witnessed sea monster attacks.
An elderly fisherman who tells tales of sea monsters to anyone who will listen.
The keeper of Bremervoord's main tavern where travelers and poets gather.
The town alderman who deals with the sea monster problem and hires help.
A mermaid prince who rules over the underwater kingdom near Bremervoord.
A mermaid who serves in Prince Agloval's underwater court.
A warrior mermaid who protects the underwater realm from surface dwellers.

3.description: A fierce dryad warrior who guards the outer borders of Brokilon Forest.
An expert huntress who tracks intruders in Brokilon and provides game for the community.
An ancient dryad who remembers the early days of the forest and advises Eithné.
A young human girl who was taken by dryads and is slowly transforming into one of them.
A human boy who was rescued by dryads and now lives in Brokilon.
An ancient tree spirit that guards the heart of Brokilon Forest.
A benevolent water spirit that dwells in Brokilon's streams and springs.

4.description: A young female apprentice studying under the senior mages at the gathering.
A male apprentice specializing in anti-magic research and dimeritium studies.
A magically animated servant that tends to the needs of the gathered mages.
A magical guardian that protects the mage gathering from intrusion.
A scholarly mage who records the proceedings of the magical council meetings.

5.description: A wealthy Oxenfurt merchant who becomes one of the vampire's victims.
A university student who falls victim to the vampire plaguing Oxenfurt.
A young acolyte who assists Father Krepp in his duties and investigations.
A city guard who patrols Oxenfurt's streets and investigates the murders.
A veteran guard who has seen many strange cases in his years of service.
The keeper of a popular inn in Oxenfurt where scholars and merchants gather.
A university professor who teaches ancient history and monster lore.

6.description: An innkeeper who provides information about refugees from Cintra.
A border guard who monitors refugee movements and helps Geralt in his search.
A Cintran father fleeing with his family who recognizes descriptions of Ciri.
A Cintran woman traveling with her husband who helps care for displaced children.
A wealthy merchant who leads a caravan and has knowledge of refugee movements.
A young woman seeking sanctuary at a temple while fleeing the war.
An elderly man who lost his home to Nilfgaardian forces and seeks temple aid.

2.description: A halfling who trades in various goods and has connections throughout the northern kingdoms.

6.description: An elven refugee who fled persecution and now wanders between human settlements.
A dwarven craftsman who lost his workshop to anti-nonhuman violence.
A bandit leader who preys on refugees and merchants traveling the roads.
A bandit who scouts for valuable targets among the refugee caravans.
An elder from a village that was destroyed by war who leads other survivors.

1.description: A professional scout who carries messages between various groups and kingdoms.

5.description: A young healer training in the temple arts who aids refugees and the wounded.

2.description: A female minstrel who travels between towns, collecting and spreading songs and stories.

1.description: A wandering knight seeking glory and gold who joins various expeditions.

3.description: An old hermit living on the edges of Brokilon who knows the forest's secrets.

4.description: A promising young sorceress studying advanced magic at the gathering.

1.description: A medic who tends to wounds during the dangerous dragon hunting expedition.
A magical guardian that protects the dragon's eggs from those who would exploit them.
A local guide who knows the treacherous mountain paths where the dragon lairs.

2.description: The first mate of Captain Pantoufle's ship who has experience with sea monsters.
A sailor with exceptional eyesight who watches for sea monsters from the crow's nest.
A fisherman who specializes in net fishing and has lost nets to sea monsters.
A skilled pearl diver who knows the underwater caves where sea creatures dwell.
The master of Bremervoord's docks who coordinates shipping and fishing activities.
A merchant who deals in salt and preserved fish, essential for coastal trade.

3.description: A dryad scout who moves silently through the forest to gather information.
A dryad tracker who follows trails and signs through Brokilon's depths.
A water nymph who dwells in Brokilon's streams and aids the dryads.
A gentle flower spirit that tends to Brokilon's magical blossoms.
An ancient treant who guards the oldest groves of Brokilon Forest.

4.description: A mage who manages magical supplies and components for the gathering.
A mage who specializes in teleportation magic and maintains the gathering's portals.
A mage specializing in illusion magic who protects the gathering from prying eyes.
A mage who specializes in divination and provides glimpses of possible futures.
An alchemical expert who creates potions and elixirs for the mage gathering.

5.description: A human under vampire control who serves as a servant and spy.
A woman enthralled by the vampire who lures victims to secluded locations.
A sergeant in the Order of the Flaming Rose who leads patrols in Oxenfurt.
A young initiate of the Order learning the ways of religious warfare.
The keeper of Oxenfurt Academy's vast library who aids in research.
A dedicated student studying ancient history and monster lore.
A student focusing on magical theory and practical applications.
The town baker who supplies bread to the university and local population.
The city blacksmith who forges weapons and tools for various customers.
A skilled seamstress who creates robes for scholars and uniforms for guards.

6.description: A merchant who travels the roads selling goods to refugees and survivors.
A professional tracker who hunts fugitives and missing persons for coin.
A knight wandering the land in search of noble deeds and worthy causes.
A ferryman who transports people across rivers, often carrying news between settlements.
A stable master who cares for horses and provides fresh mounts to travelers.

1.description: A mountain shepherd who grazes flocks near the dragon's territory and provides local knowledge.
An old woman who predicts weather patterns crucial for the dragon hunt timing.
A craftsman who makes the special ropes needed for mountain climbing during the hunt.

2.description: A coastal watcher who maintains signal fires and watches for sea monsters.
A person who gathers food and materials from tidal pools and knows sea creature habits.

3.description: The spirit of the greatest oak tree in Brokilon, ancient beyond memory.
A tiny fairy that dwells in mushroom circles throughout Brokilon Forest.

4.description: A spirit that guards the magical library at the mage gathering location.
A magical being that maintains the scrying crystals used by the mages.

5.description: A mysterious vendor who sells unusual items in Oxenfurt's night markets.

6.description: A mysterious figure who speaks of destiny and the importance of Geralt finding Ciri.

recaps.1: Geralt joins a dragon hunt with Yennefer, the knight Eyck, the dwarf Yarpen Zigrin, and the mysterious Borch Three Jackdaws. The hunt reveals deeper truths about the nature of good and evil.
recaps.2: In the coastal town of Bremervoord, Geralt deals with a sea monster while Dandelion falls for the poetess Little Eye. A tale of love, loss, and the price of a witcher's life.
recaps.3: Geralt enters Brokilon Forest and encounters the dryads, where he meets a young Ciri for the first time. Their destiny begins to unfold, though neither fully understands it yet.
recaps.4: At a sorcerers' gathering on Thanedd Island, Geralt navigates the complex politics of mages while dealing with his relationship with Yennefer.
recaps.5: Geralt investigates a series of murders in Oxenfurt, dealing with religious zealotry and prejudice while uncovering a vampire's hunting ground.
recaps.6: After the fall of Cintra to Nilfgaard, Geralt finally accepts his destiny and searches for Ciri, finding her at last in a merchant's wagon.
